page.title: 07A Local Colliery.
page.content: The Six Bells Colliery is one of the last ,few surviving coal mines in the western valley of Gwent.It is quite an old pit and there has been talk that it might close in a few years time.It is very noticeable in the valley as it has two sets of winding gear,both of which are painted blue.Most of the miners live in the villages of Six Bells,Aberbeeg and Llanhilleth,which are all fairly close by.On Tuesday 28th June 1960,twenty five years ago,there was a terrible explosion in the pit.Forty five miners were killed and part of the pit was destroyed.It was one of the worst mining disasters in Wales and is still remembered by local people today.
